textos_fuente.text: Milton‚Äôs Blackwater Bistro gets menu upgrade under new chef, director News Sports Play Opinion Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals DINING Milton's Blackwater Bistro is changing, but owners say it is for the best Brittany Misencik Pensacola News Journal Milton‚Äôs Blackwater Bistro is filled to the brim with history. The restaurant, a former family residence from the early 1900s, has been transformed into one of Milton‚Äôs go-to spots for elevated dining in the area. While the restaurant embraces preserving its history ‚Äî original flooring, walls and windows still intact ‚Äî it is seeing a modern twist with the addition of Jason Brewer as the new culinary director of operations. Brewer made a name for himself at Pace‚Äôs Bar515 Cocktails & Tapas where he shined in creating playful tapas and uniquely composed entrees. Under Brewer‚Äôs leadership, Bar515 earned the best restaurant award in the Pace/Miton area in the 2022 Best of the Bay awards. Brewer himself won the Best Chef category for 2022. Brewer's experience as a professional chef goes back over 25 years. He has gained experience from different cities and chefs, such as world-renowned celebrity chef Emeril Lagasse at Delmonico Steakhouse, that he has brought with him to Pensacola. The current Blackwater menu is built on country classics, like the hearty Mom‚Äôs Meatloaf, Chicken Pot Pie loaded with country veggies and a deep-dish Marie‚Äôs Lasagna. But Brewer plans to add more modernized, elevated options to the menu to keep even the regular customers on their toes. Looking for a free mini puzzle? Play the USA TODAY Quick Cross now. Blackwater Bistro owners Paul and Pam Kilmartin are excited to see the restaurant evolving as Milton does, ‚Äúfinally becoming a destination we always thought it would be.‚Äù ‚ÄúWe are thrilled to have Jason be part of the Bistro family,‚Äù the Kilmartins wrote in a statement. ‚ÄúHis reputation and experience speaks for itself. Jason‚Äôs reputation and expertise will take the Bistro from a good restaurant ‚Äî to a great restaurant.‚Äù Brewer said he has big plans for Blackwater Bistro‚Äôs future. ‚ÄúBasically, what I‚Äôm coming in to do is enhancing ‚Äî doing everything I possibly can to work with the team to enhance people‚Äôs dining experience,‚Äù Brewer said. ‚ÄúI feel like the restaurant is doing amazing and has a lot of hidden potential that we haven‚Äôt cracked into yet. ‚Ä¶ The staff, the owners, the management ‚Äî everybody here has just been open arms welcoming to me.‚Äù More on Brewer's time at Bar515 Bar515 Cocktails & Tapas creates social hangout in Pace, with the help of a local pro chef Looking for Milton eats? Best Milton restaurants: Nine restaurants that do Southern cooking (and more) right What changes are coming for Blackwater Bistro? Brewer will be starting off slowly with introducing weekend dinner specials before he touches the permanent menu. Over the next few months he will sift through the menu‚Äôs best hits to see what should stay or go. He has a loyal crew ready to learn, some who have been with the restaurant since its conception, who can help execute dishes the restaurant has not seen before. For his first dinner feature that debuted last week, he worked with his staff on a pan-seared triggerfish with smoked green tomato gazpacho, roasted fingerling potatoes and a cilantro and lime crema. This week, he has a braised lamb shank with sun-dried tomato feta polenta in the works. ‚ÄúWith the equipment and everything we have here, I have the opportunity to do a lot crazier kind of specials and dinner features that can really showcase the abilities of the staff here and try to bring in more of a clientele,‚Äù Brewer said. Not only does he plan to enhance the menu‚Äôs complexity, but also to incorporate more local ingredients into the dishes. His long-term goal is to create a menu that changes every season with rotating items. He would also like to increase the variety of fresh fish and specialty meats. ‚ÄúI was talking to staff the other day, it‚Äôs like, ‚ÄòWe‚Äôve all been out to dinner, we‚Äôve all heard the same song and dance for years and years and years. How can you make yourself stick out? How can you make us stick out giving just a little bit more touch that they can‚Äôt get anywhere else?‚Äô‚Äù Brewer said. Brewer said he also plans to take some of the house cocktails to the next level to make Blackwater Bistro a place to enjoy a craft cocktail in the city. He said the current menu has a variety of popular drinks, but he would like to add some special touches, like muddled fruits and smoked glasses. ‚ÄúThe craft cocktail, speakeasy style bar is what is popular right now, and it‚Äôs not going anywhere,‚Äù Brewer said. ‚ÄúThe bar staff here is very, very good and they‚Äôre very knowledgeable.‚Äù Even as the menu gets some upgrades, he plans to hold onto the same comfortable atmosphere that makes it a favorite spot for family friendly get-togethers, friend celebrations or date nights. ‚ÄúI want to be able to do that style of food, but then I want people to come in and not have that uptight fine-dining atmosphere,‚Äù Brewer said. ‚ÄúIf you come in here in a pair of shorts and a tank top, or you come in here in a suit ‚Äî you‚Äôre going to get treated the same and you‚Äôre going to enjoy your food." Follow the Blackwater Bistro Facebook page for further updates and information. Order the Italian Pizza for a filling and flavorful lunch option, perfect for sharing. Sample the sweet potato waffle fries, which are highly recommended as a must-try side dish. Enjoy the live music on Fridays and Saturdays, adding to the vibrant atmosphere of the bistro. Ask for Madison as your server for attentive and friendly service, as she is frequently praised by guests. Click here to send a gift up to $1,000 with the suggestion to use it at Blackwater Bistro. Is this your business? Claim your business to update business information, customize this listing, and more! Learn more about Blackwater Bistro Price $$ Ambience Casual Hours Tuesday-Thursday: 11AM-9PM Friday-Saturday: 11AM-10PM Sunday: 9AM-2PM Blackwater Bistro is a charming restaurant located in downtown Milton, Florida. This local eatery is well-loved for its warm atmosphere and delicious menu offerings, making it a favorite among residents and visitors alike. Ambiance : Casual dining with outdoor seating options that create a welcoming environment. Cuisine : Features a diverse menu including breakfast, sandwiches, pizzas, and southern-inspired dishes. Highlights : Known for its friendly service with standout staff members, and a lively atmosphere with live music on weekends. With a focus on fresh ingredients and a varied menu, diners can enjoy anything from hearty brunch options to flavorful lunch sandwiches. The restaurant also takes pride in its service, with staff often going the extra mile to ensure a pleasant dining experience. Whether stopping in for a casual meal or a special occasion, Blackwater Bistro guarantees satisfaction for all who visit. Customer Reviews Kayanna P. 08/05/2025 First timers, Place was great, server Madison Took great care of us and was very attentive! Will be back! read review Katie B. 08/19/2025 This is my second time here...I'm not local but have enjoyed this place both times I've come! The service was great- Natalie was an awesome server... she... read review Carolyn S. 07/03/2025 One of my besties and I had lunch here. She ordered the artichoke cheesecake for our appetizer. Amazing, delicious, decadent, etc., I could keep on going.... read review Great Alternatives Buy a Gift & Greeting Card for Masons : Masons is a charming and welcoming restaurant nestled in the heart of Milton, serving up delectable cuisine that delights the taste buds and leaves a lasting impression. About Us ‚Äì Blackwater Rising Skip to content info@blackwaterrising.org Contact Board Log In About Events Volunteer Donate Toggle Search Toggle Mobile Menu Growing Food, Growing Community Blackwater Rising brings people together to grow fresh, nutritious food and share it with neighbors who need it most. Through community gardens across Cambridge, MD, we‚Äôre helping our town eat well‚Äîand having fun along the way. From the soil up, our work is about more than food‚Äîit‚Äôs about connection, care, and community. Our mission is inspired by the long-standing spirit of determination that defines Cambridge. Rooted in resilience, we honor the legacy of local changemakers by growing something new: stronger relationships, greater food access, and a healthier, more joyful place to call home. üôå  All Hands Welcome Whether you‚Äôre a Master Gardener, an artist, a neighbor with a shovel, or someone who just likes to weed, there‚Äôs a place for you here. Our team is made up of volunteers, donors, and partners who believe in building something better‚Äîtogether. We‚Äôre cultivating trust, resilience, and joy‚Äîright here in our own backyard. Volunteer üåø Dig Into Our Feed Follow us on Facebook to see what‚Äôs growing and get the latest updates from the garden. Visit Facebook ¬© 2025 Blackwater Rising. All rights reserved. Who We Are | Blackwater Distillery Skip to content Enjoy FREE SHIPPING with all orders over ‚Ç¨60  *Ireland only. Blackwater Distillery Shop Gift Sets Gin Whiskey Vodka All Products Visit Us Our Spirits Gin Vodka Irish Whisky Cocktails Podcast About Who We Are Our Location A Little History Blog Shop Now Who We Are Home / About / Who We Are We Are A Micro-Distillery Based In West Waterford On The Banks Of The Blackwater River We like to keep it real, which is why early in the morning we switch on the lights, open the post and fire up the still. In our 1950s coverted hardware store in Ballyduff, we make award-winning gin and small batch Irish whisky. Our Team Peter Mulryan Founder & CEO View Profile √ó Peter Mulryan Founder & CEO In the days before Blackwater Distillery, Peter traveled the world as a TV producer and in his spare time wrote several books about whiskey. Now he runs a distillery, his goal is to produce excellent spirits and bring transparency and honesty to the category. When he‚Äôs not working he‚Äôs either eating, sleeping or playing the mandolin. peter@blackwaterdistillery.ie Close Caroline Senior Founder & COO View Profile √ó Caroline Senior Founder & COO Caroline Senior brings years of organisational expertise to the Blackwater team. In her time as Artistic Director at Garter Lane Arts Centre in Waterford, she was responsible for the complete refurbishment of the theatre, and produced and toured several theatre productions with Waterford playwright, Jim Nolan. She brought these skills to the refurbishment of the distillery‚Äôs new home and visitor‚Äôs centre in 2017-18, transforming a former 1950s hardware store in the heart of Ballyduff Upper. A former member of the Arts Council and a classically trained musician, Caroline plays piano and cello, and is relishing the prospect of her greatest challenge to date ‚Äì the formation of the Blackwater Distillery Band. caroline@blackwaterdistillery.ie Close John Wilcox Head Distiller View Profile √ó John Wilcox Head Distiller John jumped across the pond in late 2018 to join the Blackwater team. With over a decade working in the craft spirits sector in the US, he brings to Blackwater a diverse portfolio of experience and ideas. He specialises in mixed grain whisky, and is particularly excited about the continued evolution of the whisky category in Ireland. John is proud to call Ireland home, and considers it an honour to be part of the movement to revive heritage Irish whisky styles. In his free time,¬†John¬†battles demons with his fiddle, explores forgotten ruins, and, time permitting, slays dragons. John‚Äôs Life Goals, 2020, Lockdown Edition Go to the pub Yell at mountains with Bjork Secure world peace by making the best whisky possible john@blackwaterdistillery.ie Close Dan Grummell Brand Manager View Profile √ó Dan Grummell Brand Manager A proud Kerry man by way of London, Dan joined Blackwater in 2018 as our Brand Manager after working for nearly a decade in FMCG marketing teams. As Dan said, working at Blackwater Distillery is much more than a job, it‚Äôs a lifestyle of working with real friends who want to put this distillery on the global map and most importantly have some fun along the way. A massive lover of sports and most recently photography, he can also be found most weekends coaching his son‚Äôs soccer team to let off some steam! Looking after our marketing and local sales, Dan is the man and can be contacted on dan@blackwaterdistillery.ie or +353 85 256 1967 dan@blackwaterdistillery.ie Close Leslie Fitzell Non-Executive Director View Profile √ó Leslie Fitzell Non-Executive Director Joining the Blackwater Team in 2019, Leslie is Non Executive Director and provides strategic advice to the board and management team. He brings a breadth and depth of experience across ¬†food and drink, having worked in a range of international strategy, ¬†marketing and commercial ¬†roles in companies including Unilever, Bass, United Distillers and over 20 years at Seagram/Pernod Ricard. Leslie left Chivas Brothers, Pernod Ricard‚Äôs largest global brand company¬† in 2018 where he was Board director with responsibilities for Strategy & Development covering the scotch and gin portfolio. Today, Leslie lives outside London and specialises in supporting and helping develop a range of startups and early stage disruptor food and drinks companies to achieve their ambitions. leslie@blackwaterdistillery.ie Close Barry Donnellan Director View Profile √ó Barry Donnellan Director Over 25 years working in the television industry as a cameraman, Barry has been lucky to have travelled the world doing what he‚Äôs loved since the age of 16. It‚Äôs this job and the inclement Irish weather that he has to thank for his involvement in Blackwater Distillery. It all started on a wet stormy Kerry beach in 2014, when then-RTE producer Peter Mulryan told of his plans to open a distillery. Barry jumped at the chance of this new adventure and joined him as one of the co-founders and directors in the company. As a committed vodka drinker he has been dragged kicking and screaming along with the gin revolution and he‚Äôs learned to love the smell of juniper‚Ä¶.well, most of the time! They say that ‚Äòit never rains but it pours‚Äô but sometimes, just sometimes, it is worth standing in the rain and getting a little wet‚Ä¶you never know what might happen! barry@blackwaterdistillery.ie Close Quick Links Home Story Gin Whisky Vodka Visit Us Blog Contact Shop Sitemap Contact Blackwater Distillery Ballyduff Upper Co Waterford P51 C5C 6 Ireland Tel: +353 (0) 58 60732 Email: hello@blackwaterdistillery.ie Follow Us Check out our social media. We're on facebook, twitter, instagram, youtube.
